I thanked you formerly in the matter of Lentulus, for having saved him, as he had saved me. Yet on reading the letter he has sent me full of thank- fulness for your generous kindness, I feel that his safety is my debt as much as his. If you understand my gratitude to him, pray give me the opportunity of showing my gratitude to Pompey too.

XII

CICERO ΤΟ ATTICUS, GREETING.

I had just read your letter on the 20th, when an Formiae, epistle was brought to me *from Lepta announcing Marclz 20, that Pompey was blockaded and that even escape 13.C. 49 from the harbour was cut off by a fleet. Upon my honour tears prevent me from thinking or writing anything else. Ι send you a copy of the letter. Wretches that we are, why did we not all follow his fortunes together?
